required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Fluid Treatment and the Impact of Gender in a Septic Population

brief_summary.textblock: In this single-center study the investigators will analyze gender differences among patients with suspected sepsis admitted to the Emergency Department at Södersjukhuset during a period of two years. About 11 000 patients will be included. Patient data including fluid therapy will be drawn from the electronic medical record; Take Care and Clinisoft. In the logistic regression analysis, the investigators will adjust for age, gender, comorbidities, vital signs, preliminary focus of infection, level of care and renal replacement therapy. The aim is to analyze gender differences in fluid treatment and the response to fluid treatment and if the treatment is associated with differences in mortality.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Fluid therapy during the first six hours (adherence to sepsis bundles) and the first five days after admission.
primary_outcome.description: Millilitres of fluid given per kilogram of patient weight (ml/kg).

secondary_outcome.measure: Association between amount of fluid and mortality
secondary_outcome.description: Analyze the whole cohort and female/ male gender as subgroups
Type according to Anatomical, Therapeutic and Chemical Classification System

secondary_outcome.measure: Association between fluid therapy and levels of lactat
secondary_outcome.description: Analyze the whole cohort and female/ male gender as subgroups

secondary_outcome.measure: Association between fluid therapy and need for/ dose of vasopressors/inotropic drugs
secondary_outcome.description: Analyze the whole cohort and female/ male gender as subgroups

study_pop.textblock: The population is patients admitted at the emergency department at Södersjukhuset in Southern Stockholm. Södersjukhuset has 600 hospital beds and manages most medical fields except for highly specialized care for example neuro and thoracic surgery. 130 000 patients are seeking medical care yearly which makes the emergency department at Södersjukhuset the most frequented in Scandinavia.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients admitted to the emergency department with suspected sepsis (defined by blood culture taken and intravenous sepsis-antibiotics prescribed within 48 hours) and fulfilling sepsis-3 definition of sepsis (sequential organ failure assesment score of 2 or more)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients transferred from other hospitals or treatment clinics.
